ID394.text: She sent me off on a tight-bound raft , with a wealth of provisions , bread and glowing wine , and gave me everlasting garments to wear , and sent a following wind , warm and gentle . /

ID397.text: Earth-Shaker brought me . He roused the winds against me , blocked my path , and raised huge waves , so the sea refused to leave me alone as I sat there groaning ceaselessly aboard my raft .

ID398.text: Instead the storm wrecked it , and I reached here , swimming the great gulf till the wind and waves

ID400.text: When I tried to gain the land , the breakers dashed me against a dangerous stretch of cliff , but I backed away , and swam till I came to a river mouth , where there was a likely place , free of rocks and sheltered from the wind . I staggered clear , and lay there , gasping for breath , while deathless night fell .
ID400.lemma: when I try to gain the land , the breaker dash me against a dangerous stretch of cliff , but I back away , and swim till I come to a river mouth , where there be a likely place , free of rock and shelter from the wind . I stagger clear , and lie there , gasp for breath , while deathless night fall .

ID401.text: Then I climbed from the bed of the heaven-fed river , and , gathering leaves around me , lay down to rest in a thicket .
ID401.lemma: then I climb from the bed of the heaven-fed river , and , gather leave around me , lay down to rest in a thicket .

ID402.text: Then a god shed boundless sleep upon me .
ID402.lemma: then a god shed boundless sleep upon me .

ID403.text: So I slept all night through , exhausted , among the leaves , through morning and till noon , and the sun began to set before sweet sleep released me .
ID403.lemma: so I sleep all night through , exhaust , among the leave , through morning and till noon , and the sun begin to set before sweet sleep release me .

ID404.text: Then I saw your daughter�s maids playing on the sand , and she among them looking like a goddess . I made my prayer to her , and she was full of understanding , in a way you would not expect from one so young , since the young are ever thoughtless .

ID405.text: She gave me plenty of bread and glowing wine , bathed me in the river , and gave me these clothes .
